cookingMethod: In a bowl, combine the ground meat, chopped onion, tomatoes, green chilies, coriander leaves, pomegranate seeds, cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, salt, and egg.
Mix well to form a uniform mixture.
Shape the mixture into flat, round kebabs.
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat.
Fry the kebabs until they are golden brown and cooked through.
Serve hot with naan or roti.
In a bowl, mix the ground meat, chopped onion, green chilies, ginger-garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt.
Divide the mixture into portions and shape each portion onto a wooden skewer, forming a cylindrical kebab.
Preheat a grill or barbecue.
Brush the kebabs with oil and grill them, turning occasionally, until cooked and slightly charred.
Serve with naan, raita, and chutney.
Heat oil or ghee in a karahi (wok) and sauté the chopped onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and the oil starts to separate.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well.
Add pre-cooked chickpeas and mix with the masala.
Cook for a few minutes, allowing the flavors to meld.
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and green chilies. Serve with naan or rice.
In a bowl, combine the ground meat, chopped onion, tomatoes, green chilies, coriander leaves, pomegranate seeds, cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, salt, and egg.
Mix well to form a uniform mixture.
Shape the mixture into flat, round kebabs.
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat.
Fry the kebabs until they are golden brown and cooked through.
Serve hot with naan or roti.
Heat oil or ghee in a karahi (wok) and sauté the sliced onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
Add chicken pieces and cook until they change color.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well.
Cover and cook until the chicken is tender and the masala is cooked.
Add chopped tomatoes and green chilies. Cook until tomatoes are soft.
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve with naan or roti.

ingredients: 1 kg lamb or goat meat, cut into pieces
cookingMethod: Heat oil or ghee in a karahi (wok) and sauté the sliced onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
Add the meat pieces and cook until they change color.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well.
Cover and cook until the meat is tender and oil separates from the masala.
Add chopped tomatoes and green chilies. Cook until tomatoes are soft.
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve hot with naan or roti.
